summary: The Public Housing Fire Safety Act (H.R. 4359) aims to improve fire safety in public housing. It mandates the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) to report on the presence of automatic sprinkler systems in public housing during inspections. The bill establishes a competitive grant program to provide funds to public housing agencies for installing automatic sprinkler systems in exempted public housing projects. It also authorizes appropriations to the Capital Fund for this purpose.
